attributes.action: Make it compulsory for vendors to produce a Home Survey prior to marketing
attributes.background:
I paid for 1 survey & vendors withdrew from market
Paid for survey on 2nd house & found pure asbestos
Paid for survey on 3rd house & found structural movement
Paid for survey to buy 4th house
And other buyers will also have to pay for surveys on those same houses.

attributes.action: Introduce a requirement for address verification for internet applications
attributes.background: We've got to get real regarding issues with Bots and third-party actors on social networks and other internet applications. The hate and anger we are seeing online must be stopped and one of the only tools we have to do so is to make people prove who they say they are.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am proposing is this...

Any application designed for access by the general public and allowing internal messaging or commenting or any other intra-user communication must verify the postal address of users.

All applications to either filter out un-verified users by default or provide a mechanism to allow users to opt-in and opt-out of receiving messages from un-verified users. 

All existing application users to be subject to the same verification procedure within a time limit.

attributes.action: Make Michaelmas Day (29th September) a public holiday.
attributes.background:
Michaelmas (Mickle-mas) was The Feast of St Michael and was used to celebrate the final harvest.  Everything that couldn't be preserved was eaten in a great feast.

This holiday would be a dress rehearsal for Christmas, minus the relatives and presents!

attributes.action: Safeguard School Milk Funding Post-Brexit
attributes.background: With funding for the EU School Milk Scheme under consideration, and the Nursery Milk Scheme being consulted on, millions of children may be at risk of missing out on milk that generations before them received. We're calling on the Government to commit to funding a replacement scheme post-Brexit

attributes.action: Prevent housing associations from charging tennents for essential tree work.
attributes.background: A family member of mine who lives in a housing association house had a dangerous tree in their garden. The Housing Association wanted to charge them more than £2000 to carry out the work needed to make the tree safe. I complained and won, but they continued to implement this unfair policy on others.
attributes.additional_details: Housing associations are using a loophole in the law designed for private tenants to include tree work as "standard maintenance" (along with changing bulbs) in their tenancy agreement. As the owner of the property, and therefore the tree, the housing association should be held liable for any risk posed by dangerous trees in their tenant's gardens. So forcing the tenants to pay for tree work to mitigate the risk that they (the tenant) are not responsible for is unfair and should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of homework received by primary school students.
attributes.background: Being a student myself, I know the struggle. Children in primary education receive an unnecessary amount of homework each week, and need to be enjoying their childhood, and being more active. The only important homework is reading and spellings.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the homework they receive is sometimes difficult to understand, and not always relevant to their learning. Not only do the students feel pressurised at such a young age, but it can also cause conflict at home between the student and their parents. This is due to the parents also feeling stressed.

attributes.action: Make Humanist weddings legally recognised in England and Wales
attributes.background: Humanist weddings have been legal in Scotland for over a decade, but in England and Wales they are not legally recognised. Couples wanting to have a Humanist ceremony have to pay to be legally married by a registrar separately to their Humanist ceremony, increasing costs and practicality issues.
attributes.additional_details:
https://humanism.org.uk/ceremonies/non-religious-weddings/faqs/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/sep/17/humanist-weddings-scotland-england-wales

https://humanism.org.uk/2018/05/24/parliamentarians-call-for-legal-humanist-marriages-in-england-and-wales/

attributes.action: Introduce official national ID cards or make PASS cards part of the law
attributes.background: Many people lose their IDs such as driving license which is difficult and costly to replace.PASS hologram cards supposedly should fix this problem but until this day not every place recognises this type of identification.We need the government to introduce something that would be recognisable fully
attributes.additional_details: PASS hologram cards don’t work everywhere from my experience as many places like nightclubs are not even aware of them and usually they reject people that have them. What is the point for the government to support a scheme that is not effective. We need a government issued national ID or make PASS hologram cards part of official identification here in England in order to solve this problem as carrying driving licences or passports is a big risk to take and a long process to replace

attributes.action: Make it law that savings interest rates go up same time as loans & mortgages.
attributes.background: This last decade's rock-bottom interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest, because banks are quick to raise rates on loans & mortgages after BoE hikes, but are reluctant to offer the same, timely hikes for savings. Savers see this as immoral an highway robbery on our High Streets.
attributes.additional_details:
Before the 2008 crisis, from 1998 to 2007, savers earned £233 billion in interest. Following it, from 2008 to 2017, they earned just £129 billion because banks fail to pass on rate rises announced by the BoE.
Interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest payments https://dailym.ai/2ot5PJ3 
Millions of savers are being hit by rip-off rates https://dailym.ai/2PzyEin
 
We request that our MP's debate this in Parliament and create a new law that will enforce timely equitable treatment for interest rates on savings and retrospectively make good the deficit.

attributes.action: Up grade the A34 to motorway standard.
attributes.background: The A34 is a major road linking motorways, it regularly suffers from road closures due to accidents. These affect the economy and cause major problems on surrounding roads as there is no suitable alternative route.  It has been stated by numerous people that the A34 is no longer fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Stop charging NHS workers  to pay for registration renewel
attributes.background: I want action because NHS workers shouldn’t have to pay to go to work. They work long hours with stretched resources, often their is not enough staff with little opportunity for breaks. Both my parents work for the NHS, with my mother having been part of the service for more than 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Renewing registration can cost practitioners in the NMC £120 per year and practitoners in the hcpc costs £180 for two years registration. They pay the fee despite wage rises being frozen for two years from 2011, and increases capped at 1% until this year. However, despite the proposed pay increases this won’t cover the registration fee and is minimal in comparison to inflation.

attributes.action: Create a criminal offence of filming/observing a crime without helping
attributes.background: Social media, and broader internet space, is being littered with videos, mostly taken on mobile phones, showing assaults on the public and police officers. Quite often, the filmmaker is with a larger group of bystanders, who all stand by and observe the violence but fail to summon help or intervene
attributes.additional_details: Involuntary manslaughter, joint enterprise and gross negligence all deal with bystander type liability. But they require some kind of intent or legal duty. What about those who have no intent to harm anyone, and only owe a moral duty, and not statutory. It’s not acceptable for a person, without a reasonable excuse, to observe harm being done, and fail to get that person help, or if able to, attempt to stop the harm. Filming violence or doing NOTHING should never be acceptable.

attributes.action: Invite Polish Armed Forces to take a part in all future Remembrance Day Parades
attributes.background: During the war, more than 200,000 members of the Polish Armed Forces in the West had fought under British High Command. The British government did not specifically invite representatives of the Polish forces that had fought under British High Command for the London Victory Celebrations of 1946
attributes.additional_details: There is no significant effort being put in acknowledging and recognition, all the effort, sacrifice of service men and women who fought in WWII under B.H.C. These people are almost gone and are still feeling betrayed and forgotten, unappreciated. It's one of the last chances for the British Government to change the mistake of the historical decisions and make it good for the future and for the post Brexit relations between Poles living in the UK and Britons.

attributes.action: Scrap the CQC as an onerous bombastic regulation lead organisation
attributes.background: The CQC and its predecessors have developed this watch dog role since 2004, and it’s worth asking what if anything, these state appointed monitors have contributed to health and social care during that time, apart from undermining leadership and interrupting health care delivery.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the CQC have made clear mistakes over recent years. It is clear that they are unlikely to change their methodology and a majority of health care professionals across the country think they are not fit for purpose, and wish to see a change in the way health and social care is regulated.

attributes.action: Ban night shift working, for the sake of the health of workers
attributes.background: Studies have established that the health of workers in the UK is directly negatively affected by night shift working. I ask Parliament to hold a debate over this practice. Why are hard-working people being made to suffer unnecessarily, and why does the Health and Safety at Work Act not protect them?
attributes.additional_details: Long-term night shift work is associated with an increased risk of certain cancers, as well as metabolic problems, heart disease, ulcers and gastrointestinal problems. People who work night shifts or rotating shifts often don't sleep enough. Long-term sleep deprivation is known to be bad for health. Statistics show that a large amount of UK workers are shift workers and, in particular, night shift workers.

attributes.action: Stop playing Vivaldi as hold music on the benefit enquiries line.
attributes.background: Whilst it is understandable that businesses do need waiting music to occupy the minds of enquirers, playing Vivaldi's 'Spring' over and over again creates associations incompatible with the normal levels of appreciation that one should have for such a classical musician.
attributes.additional_details: Several benefit numbers spout the same song over and over again. After 15 minutes one becomes irked. After 20 minutes, the music has slightly disturbing undertones and after 30 minutes the listener turns exasperated, frantic and starts to shout at their handset. This is not ideal: it breeds frustration and resentment at Vivaldi, the benefits line and possibly the government as a whole.

attributes.action: Make repeat offenders pay a percentage for emergency service costs
attributes.background:
Persons who are being repeatdly arrested for offending for: affray, public disturbance, ABH or GBH should pay a percentage of the emergency service costs which attended the scene.
Court costs recover some expenses but not all. A levy should be applied in these cases.
attributes.additional_details:
This method would help as a deterrent to knife attacks/gang crime, and it would also make it fair for persons who do not cause undue expenses from the emergency services.
Crime is on the rise and there are more gangs than ever.
This levy could also be expanded to moped theft gangs for the expense of a vehicle/foot pursuit.
Some persons cannot afford fines, but in that case then this would also help a legal case to get the dangerous repeat offenders locked up.

attributes.action: Ban smoking in apartments/flats
attributes.background: Smoking ban should be extended to apartments/flats, where there is a high and sustained risk of secondary inhalation. And where smokers reduce the health and life quality of neighbours.
attributes.additional_details: Ministry of Health is aware but choosing not to extend a ban to apartments for reasons unknown. However, as more and more of us are forced to live in apartments, a radical health policy rethink is required, and tougher legislation introduced.

attributes.action: Stop the Lifetime ISA & allow customers to withdraw their money with no penalty
attributes.background: Lifetime Isas allow adults under 40 to save for their first home or pension in one pot with a 25 per cent bonus from the Government. They were revealed in the 2016 budget and launched in April 2017. However, many are being caught out by the strict withdrawal rules.

attributes.action: The United Kingdom should have its very own  Interstellar Space Force.
attributes.background: In order to maintain close ties with our greatest ally, the United States, I call upon the UK government to pledge to the nation that we will introduce a bill for the establishment of a new branch of the Armed Forces - our very own Space Force.
attributes.additional_details: We just need it.

attributes.action: Automatic general election on change in the leadership of the governing party.
attributes.background: Given the substantial change in the character of a political party on changing its leadership, it seems undemocratic for the mandate from a general election to automatically transfer to a new leader with potentially completely different policies without consulting the electorate.
attributes.additional_details: The law should be changed to require a General Election if the leadership of the governing party changes.

attributes.action:
Change minimum wage to at least £10 an hour. 

Stop the struggle!
attributes.background:
Life is a struggle already, without factoring in the low minimum wage the uk are made to endure. Living cost keeps going up, but we are all stuck trying to climb back on top.

We need this to change our country and to better it, and create a future that is bright.
attributes.additional_details:
Life within our current economic climate is a struggle, and stability is essentially unachievable. Living costs are increasing but minimum wage is staying the same. 

Therefore, we need to galvanise our country  into making a change and to ensure our future generations are prosperous

attributes.action: Stop under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified
attributes.background: Stop all under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified at 18 same as gambling sites to eliminate child grooming and paedophile activity
attributes.additional_details: Girls are adding random guys all over the world and sending illicit photos of themselves and sexting my daughter was 1 of these at the age of 16 I have now took all media off her including her phone but I would like it stopped nationally as it's unsafe for any child

attributes.action: Make "vlogging" whilst driving illegal
attributes.background: Many youtubers are creating vlog videos whilst driving where they are talking to and looking at their camera and therefore becoming distracted from the road and becoming dangers to themselves and other road users. This will be encouraging others, especially young inexperienced drivers to do the same
attributes.additional_details: Vlogging is a form of online video blog usually shared via YouTube in which an individual talks to a camera, adrressing the audience. 100s of vlogs and drive with me videos can be accessed at the click of button. Those featured in these vlogs are popular young adults acting as role models for young and vulnerable teenagers who won't always realise they can be putting their own and other lives at risk if they are inspired to copy the actions as the youtubers face no consequence for their actions

attributes.action: Give full time members of the armed forces a council tax exemptions
attributes.background: Service personnel who live in a property that is not on a base have to pay council tax, however many of these due to where they are based actually live in these addresses minimally. they have to pay SILCOT the armed forces equivalent of council tax, as such they effectively pay double council tax

attributes.action: Make black plastic illegal
attributes.background: Currently in the UK only a third of plastic can be recycled. The public have been placing their plastic in the green bins completely unawares that most will end in landfill or incinerated. One of the quickest ways the Government can reduce this is to ban black plastic packaging.
attributes.additional_details: This featured as a main story on the BBC news on the 4th of August 2018.

attributes.action: Make it a law that every work place need to supply air conditioning units.
attributes.background: Every work place now won’t supply air conditioning as it’s not Essential however if we made it a law many schools, nursurys and work places would Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no law which says you have to go home just that your work place has to supply water. 
Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Make more council houses available for part rent, part buy
attributes.background: I'm a working dad of 2 children under 2 year old. Me and my partner can't afford to live together as I don't earn enough to support us and pay private rent. The Government should introduce a scheme to make more council homes available for families to part rent part buy to get on the property ladder.
attributes.additional_details: More and more families are struggling to live together with young children. My children are 14 month old and a 2 week old. Like a lot of families me and my partner can’t afford to live together as I work full time and she doesn't as she raises the children. The systems we have in this country don't help people who work. Help to buy is only good if you can afford to save but with young children and paying rent that's more than a mortgage, it's hard to save.

attributes.action: Ban Online Casinos
attributes.background: Online casinos cause misery for the user and their families and friends.This is an addictive gambling machine and not a fun way to waste peoples money. Ban all online and shop based slot machines.

attributes.action: Increase funding to police forces
attributes.background: As aired on ‘crimewave 2018: a lawless Britain’ 9 out of 10 crimes go unsolved and police lack resources.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has suffered from the increase of crime especially knife crime as well as an increase of burglaries over the past year, this is the result of decreased funding the government has given the police. We now need the government to give police forces in England and Wales enough funds to be able to put more police officers on our streets to keep the public safe and to increase funding. They should also increase funding to Scotland and Northern Ireland so that they can do the same.

attributes.action: Free Sanitary products for women and girls on benefits
attributes.background: Read a homeless lady on Tube crying and asking fellow passengers if any had spare Tampons or Pads ; if chaps had to use them bet they would be FOC

attributes.action: Ban smoking within 6 meters from public entrances; exempting pubs and clubs.
attributes.background: As an extension to the Health Act of 2006, extending the ban around public entrances further benefits non-smokers, while not providing additional hardships on smokers.  This benefits ground level offices mostly as smokers usually do so just outside, causing smoke to drift into nearby windows.
attributes.additional_details: In the strictest sense, no law regarding entrance proximity contravenes the Health Act as these environments are no longer smoke free.  While one cannot control wind direction and the like, distance away from these entrances would normally include distance from windows, as well as provide a better environment for visitors.  This ensures the well being and comfort of non-smokers indoors remains intact, and only requires smokers to travel a few additional steps.

attributes.action: Prevent those in Public Service from withholding data
attributes.background: Data laws are being used to cover up & block complaints. Organisations and public bodies should have to prove in court that a request is vexatious before they can refuse to give information. The ICO should be given the funds and powers to fully investigate non-compliance with the law.
attributes.additional_details: Those who don't fully comply with a request in 1 calendar month must be fined. The impact on those who suffer failure, abuse and hostility is worse if they can't access all their records to pursue a complaint. It affects the most vulnerable, those on low incomes who may not be able to access public services e.g. housing, disabled facilities, innocent children forced out of school, school bullying covered up that may lead to children self-harming or children/individuals targeted by authorities.

attributes.action: It should be mandatory for schools to provide a summer uniform
attributes.background: Schools should have to provide a summer uniform for its students such as shorts, and a polo shirt or similar. This would help people concentrate in lessons because they wouldn’t be overly hot, like I was this summer.

attributes.action: No more than 1 junction or 5 miles of roadworks, on a motorway or  A road
attributes.background:
This causes a lot of congestion and stand still traffic, there is more likely to be a road traffic incident in roadworks. 
Most of the time road works are only been worked on in a 1 mile stretch, there is no need for so many miles to be closed for years and years
attributes.additional_details:
M6- over 20 miles of motorway 2 miles of workers max, incidents at least 1 aday, 
M5 1 junction 2-3,bridge repairs hardly any incidents and not as much congestion

attributes.action: Discontinue Pay As You Dine and Reinstate Monthly Food Charges
attributes.background: Before Pay As You Dine British servicemen and women were charged a monthly food cost paid from their wages automatically, this ensured every soldier had 3 meals per day should they choose to eat at the cook house, since Payd came in the food quality has dropped dramatically, time to change!
attributes.additional_details:
Also because of lack of education and poor management a small population of soldiers have been put in a position where they cannot afford to eat, leaving the option to go “Hungry Soldier” this is incredibly degrading and embarrassing 

Discontinuing PAYD would be so much more beneficial for the servicemen of our country on a number of fronts

Things have to change

attributes.action: Allow fathers in employment to have time off for scans and parenting classes
attributes.background: First time dad. Gov.co.uk states maximum two appointments for scans etc. Employers shouldn’t be allowed to force dads to use their holidays for scan appointments. As fathers we should be allowed every appointment off work.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I have to go to various hospitals for scans to ensure everything is right. I must use my holiday hours. I can take time off for a doctors or hospital appointment, because it's for me but I can’t have time off for scans because it's not directly for me! Slight discrimination!”

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow pupils to wear skirts
attributes.background: Gender expression must not be influenced by anyone in anyway. All pupils must be allowed to wear skirts or trousers. Ability to make a choice without being judged in gender expression is important for healthy development.

attributes.action: Make causing a psychological injury (mental illness) a criminal offence.
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to make it a crime to intentionally or recklessly cause unnecessary psychological injury to another; add mental illness to the list of reportable injuries in relation to work; and ensure that the cause of any illness that leads to a suicide is fully investigated.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people suffers a mental illness during their lifetime.
Sometimes this is directly attributable to the behaviour of another or others.  In these cases the only legal remedy is a personal injury claim which lacks personal accountability and doesn't encourage improved behaviour.
In addition, psychological injuries don't currently have to be reported to the Health and Safety Executive so are not monitored.
Mental abuse is serious and should be given the same importance as physical abuse.

attributes.action: Require all buses to have seat belts
attributes.background: Buses have crashes and make sudden stops and people get injured all the time because they are not wearing seat belts.
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was involved in a bus accident (not the bus driver’s fault) where a taxi pulled out. This resulted in me being thrown from my chair and suffering bruised ribs and jarred my chest. This is why all buses should be required to have seat belts.

attributes.action: Force all meat packaging to use images of slaughterhouses to deglamourise meat
attributes.background: Packets of cigarettes after having adopted grotesque images of the effects of smoking in 2008 have reduced the number of smokers significantly in the UK. I am calling on the government to adopt a similar scheme with meat packaging in order to warn people about what they are eating.
attributes.additional_details: Pictures would be stark to illustrate the appalling conditions that animals live in; the effects on health of meat-eating; and the environmental toll that raising animals for meat has.

attributes.action: Add to the school curriculum, educating young people on current world issues
attributes.background: Educating from an early age, it would bring awareness of current issues and give young people a voice as they would have opportunities to get involved. This is important as they are the next generation, therefore, it is vital that they are aware of what is currently happening in the world.

attributes.action: Give free sanitary products for girls in primary and secondary schools.
attributes.background: As the fifth largest economy no girls should be in a place where sanitary products are not available in school. As of next year Wales will give out free sanitary products to all girls in primary and secondary schools. It now time to follow in Wales footstep.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/free-sanitary-products-given-schoolgirls-14805724

attributes.action: Increase the annual salary of all public sector workers by 3%.
attributes.background:
We, the people of Britain, would like to request an increase of the annual salary for all public sector workers by 3%. In particular, the pay wage of Police, Firefighters and workers of the NHS. 

We feel that the wages should be increased because of the heroic services they provide everyday.
attributes.additional_details:
"The starting salary for Police Officers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is between £19,971 and £23,124, rising to £38,382 at the top of the scale - achievable after about seven years.."

"Public Sector workers help you when you need it, no matter how bad of a situation. Some make you feel safe and risk their whole life for us, saving lives. They train and dedicated their life to make sure the people of Britain are safe and secure in the area that they live. They deserve more." - Nameless

attributes.action: Protect pension funds from asset strippers by closing Companies Act loopholes.
attributes.background: Under s172 Companies Act 2006, directors must "promote the success of the company" taking into account the long term consequences and the need to act fairly with stakeholders, such as employees. However, Part 23 of the Act fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous.
attributes.additional_details:
Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred out of the company and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.
Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and not appropriated from the company. 
Accumulative distributable reserves should be restricted to cover the current pension fund deficit before further distributions are considered.

attributes.action: Tax breaks for public houses that ONLY serve beverages manufactured in the UK.
attributes.background: To aid against the loss of public houses across the UK, many of which are central to a community. Also providing a boost to UK brewers/manufacturing. And creating more jobs in this sector.

attributes.action: Make the Monday following remembrance Sunday a public holiday.
attributes.background: Every other EU country have a public holiday to remember out fallen. We should forward the same respect to our fallen and currently serving member of our armed forces.

attributes.action: Allow store loyalty card schemes to award points on the purchase of baby formula
attributes.background:
The law as it stands prohibits stores from issuing loyalty card points on the sale of baby milk formula. Parents are barred from amassing points to make savings.

This is unfair to parents who don't always have a choice in using formula. Also to parents exercising their right to choose not to.
attributes.additional_details:
The Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula (England) Regulations 2007 (section 23) prohibits marketing of baby formula. Loyalty card schemes are being caught up in this, barring parents from accruing points and making savings. 

The purchase is being made regardless, without promotional inducement. The collection of points by parents cannot be called marketing.

The legislation can be found here

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2007/3521/regulation/23/made

attributes.action: Ban Govt ministers of places where homosexuality is illegal owning UK companies
attributes.background: In many countries, homosexuality is still considered a crime. This is in direct contrast to the UK, where same-sex sexual activity has been legal since 1967. Government Ministers in countries where homosexuality is still illegal should be banned from owning UK based companies.
attributes.additional_details: Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan is currently the Deputy Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, where same-sex sexual activity is illegal. He also owns City Football Group, which Manchester City FC is part of. Football is the national sport of the UK, yet the owner of the Premier League champions is Deputy Prime Minister of a country where homosexuality is illegal. If LGBT equality is to be achieved, Government Ministers from these countries cannot be permitted to own UK-based companies.

attributes.action: Stop the land asset stripping of the NHS recommended in the Naylor report.
attributes.background: Forcing NHS trusts to sell off their valuable land to cover basic costs the government won't adequately is wrong. We don't need a private profit health service system as with the US. It is unacceptable.
